text:
In addition to increasing
the efficiency of IT, using

the cloud also powers business
innovation.

Your organization can shift
its focus from the undifferentiated

heavy lifting of managing
data centers to developing

applications that truly differentiate
your business and transform
your customer experiences.

By moving from the fixed-cost
model of traditional

on-premises data centers
to the pay-for-consumption

model of cloud, you reduce
the cost of failure through

increased organizational
agility.

This means your teams can experiment
more quickly and frequently.

With this agility, you can rapidly
course correct as often as necessary.

You can end experiments
that clearly aren’t working

and increase investments
in experiments that show promise.

This empowers your organization
to find novel solutions

to problems and to cover
new, previously unseen, opportunities.

This rapid experimentation
can lead to innovative

ideas that transform the way
you work, transform industries,

and give you a competitive
advantage when it comes to delivering
value for your customers.

When you gain this type of agility,
when you can experiment

with ideas without extensive
analysis and planning,

you become bolder in what you’re
willing to try.

You step outside your comfort
zone and think outside the box

because it’s easier to be bold
when you’re no longer afraid

of the consequences
of failure.

This is what it means to truly
transform.

It isn’t about outsourcing
boring IT work or having access

to better technology—although
these are very real benefits.

It’s about having the capability
to completely transform

the way you think about your
business and having the ability

to do things you previously
never thought were possible.
